channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 NPR - For Personal Use Only

channel.itunes:summary: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast. http://www.npr.org/sections/science/

item.title: Environmental Groups Challenge EPA In Court Over Ozone Rule
item.description: August 2, 2017 - The Trump administration seeks to roll back and delay dozens of regulations across government, including one to lower smog-creating ozone. Environmental groups are challenging the EPA in court.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - The Trump administration seeks to roll back and delay dozens of regulations across government, including one to lower smog-creating ozone. Environmental groups are challenging the EPA in court. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/02/541197543/environmental-groups-challenge-epa-in-court-over-ozone-rule

item.title: Al Gore Warns That Trump Is A 'Distraction' From The Issue Of Climate Change
item.description: August 2, 2017 - "I have no illusions about the possibility of changing Donald Trump's mind," Gore says. Instead, the former vice president wants to build bipartisan consensus around the issue of climate change.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - "I have no illusions about the possibility of changing Donald Trump's mind," Gore says. Instead, the former vice president wants to build bipartisan consensus around the issue of climate change. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/02/541124579/al-gore-warns-that-trump-is-a-distraction-from-the-issue-of-climate-change

item.title: Carbon Dioxide May Rob Crops Of Nutrition, Leaving Millions At Risk
item.description: August 2, 2017 - Two new studies suggest that changing atmospheric conditions could reduce protein and iron in food, leading to more health problems for people in countries where malnutrition is already a problem.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - Two new studies suggest that changing atmospheric conditions could reduce protein and iron in food, leading to more health problems for people in countries where malnutrition is already a problem. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/08/02/540650904/carbon-dioxide-may-rob-crops-of-nutrition-leaving-millions-at-risk

item.title: NASA Jets Will Extend Eclipse By Chasing Moon's Shadow
item.description: August 2, 2017 - Cold War-era tactical bombers specially equipped with stabilized telescopes will fly over the central United States on Aug. 21, taking detailed observations of the Sun's atmosphere.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - Cold War-era tactical bombers specially equipped with stabilized telescopes will fly over the central United States on Aug. 21, taking detailed observations of the Sun's atmosphere. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/02/541155510/nasa-jets-will-extend-eclipse-by-chasing-moons-shadow

item.title: Scientists Precisely Edit DNA In Human Embryos To Fix A Disease Gene
item.description: August 2, 2017 - In experimental embryos, scientists were able to repair the gene that causes a serious heart disorder. More research is needed to confirm the method would produce healthy babies, they say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - In experimental embryos, scientists were able to repair the gene that causes a serious heart disorder. More research is needed to confirm the method would produce healthy babies, they say. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/02/540975224/scientists-precisely-edit-dna-in-human-embryos-to-fix-a-disease-gene

item.title: Oh, Snap! Scientists Are Turning People's Food Photos Into Recipes
item.description: August 2, 2017 - Researchers have created an artificial neural network that analyzes an image of a dish and tells you how to make it. Still in the early stages, the technology might help improve our dietary health.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - Researchers have created an artificial neural network that analyzes an image of a dish and tells you how to make it. Still in the early stages, the technology might help improve our dietary health. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/08/02/540022733/oh-snap-scientists-are-turning-peoples-food-photos-into-recipes

item.title: Why We Are Naively Optimistic About Climate Change
item.description: August 2, 2017 - Unfortunately, we are failing in the goal to make our children's world better than our own — and those who deny it won't have to see the consequences of their choices, says blogger Marcelo Gleiser.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - Unfortunately, we are failing in the goal to make our children's world better than our own — and those who deny it won't have to see the consequences of their choices, says blogger Marcelo Gleiser. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/02/541095519/why-we-are-naively-optimistic-about-climate-change

item.title: Drug Puts A $750,000 'Price Tag On Life'
item.description: August 1, 2017 - The high cost of Spinraza, a new and promising treatment for spinal muscular atrophy, highlights how the cost-benefit analysis insurers use to make drug coverage decisions plays out in human terms.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - The high cost of Spinraza, a new and promising treatment for spinal muscular atrophy, highlights how the cost-benefit analysis insurers use to make drug coverage decisions plays out in human terms. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/01/540100976/drug-puts-a-750-000-price-tag-on-life

item.title: Planning To Watch The Eclipse? Here's What You Need To Protect Your Eyes
item.description: August 1, 2017 - A total solar eclipse is one of the most magnificent sights you can ever see. But you need the right kind of eye protection, and some of what's being sold out there isn't safe.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - A total solar eclipse is one of the most magnificent sights you can ever see. But you need the right kind of eye protection, and some of what's being sold out there isn't safe. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/01/540661570/planning-to-watch-the-eclipse-heres-what-you-need-to-protect-your-eyes

item.title: Who Were Your Millionth-Great-Grandparents?
item.description: August 1, 2017 - Our pre-human ancestors are back there somewhere in the deep time that makes up Earth's braided history of life and change — and we are the tip of the spear moving that life forward, says Adam Frank.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - Our pre-human ancestors are back there somewhere in the deep time that makes up Earth's braided history of life and change — and we are the tip of the spear moving that life forward, says Adam Frank. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/01/540792411/who-were-your-millionth-great-grandparents

item.title: Country Music And Brain Research Come Together At Nashville Summer Camp
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Researchers in Nashville are tapping into a country music camp to learn more about Williams Syndrome, a rare genetic disorder. Many people who have it love music but don't know why.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Researchers in Nashville are tapping into a country music camp to learn more about Williams Syndrome, a rare genetic disorder. Many people who have it love music but don't know why. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/31/540553819/country-music-and-brain-research-come-together-at-nashville-summer-camp

item.title: To Help Keep Sturgeon Sustainable, Farm And Fishery Work Together
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Because demand for seafood is rising and wild stocks are not, a hatchery owner in Canada is hoping his model of "responsible agriculture" can keep the prized fish both on the menu and in the water.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Because demand for seafood is rising and wild stocks are not, a hatchery owner in Canada is hoping his model of "responsible agriculture" can keep the prized fish both on the menu and in the water. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/07/31/539591489/to-help-keep-sturgeon-sustainable-farm-and-fishery-work-together

item.title: Scientists Edge Closer To Elusive Lab Test For Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Stanford University scientists have found an array of proteins in the blood whose levels correlate closely with the severity of symptoms of the mysterious illness that's increasingly known as ME/CFS.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Stanford University scientists have found an array of proteins in the blood whose levels correlate closely with the severity of symptoms of the mysterious illness that's increasingly known as ME/CFS. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/31/540565526/scientists-edge-closer-to-elusive-lab-test-for-chronic-fatigue-syndrome

item.title: Why We All Scream When We Get Ice Cream Brain Freeze
item.description: July 31, 2017 - When temperatures soar, there's nothing like a frozen treat to take off the edge. But if we dive in too fast, our brains are thrown for a distressing and sometimes painful loop. Here's why.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - When temperatures soar, there's nothing like a frozen treat to take off the edge. But if we dive in too fast, our brains are thrown for a distressing and sometimes painful loop. Here's why. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/07/31/540062185/why-we-all-scream-when-we-get-ice-cream-brain-freeze

item.title: New Florida Law Lets Residents Challenge School Textbooks
item.description: July 31, 2017 - The new bill was pushed by a conservative group critical of the way evolution, climate change and government were being taught in Florida schools.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - The new bill was pushed by a conservative group critical of the way evolution, climate change and government were being taught in Florida schools. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/31/540041860/new-florida-law-lets-residents-challenge-school-textbooks
